page.title: 01ASHTON KEYNES AND LEIGH AREA
page.content: The villages of {Ashton Keynes}and{ {Leigh}are in{The Upper Thames Valley} which consists of silts, clays, sands and gravels. The sands and gravels have been extracted since the 1920's. They are used in concrete, blocks, tiles. lintels, pipes and in road base construction. Industry in the area is confined to mineral extraction and the building industry. Large lakes have been formed in the excavated areas because of the high water table. These lakes are being developed as nature reserves and for recreational purposes. The rest of the area around the villages is agricultural, with mainly permanent pasture, used for dairy, beef and sheep farming.
